Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to the revitalization and preservation of our charming downtown through community-driven economic development, cultural enrichment, and historic preservation. As an accredited Main Street America™ program, we are committed to fostering a vibrant, welcoming destination where residents and visitors alike can experience the heart and soul of Plant City. Through signature events like Oktoberfest, Last Friday, and the inaugural Strawberry Drop, we celebrate our heritage while creating fresh opportunities for local businesses, artists, and families to thrive. At the core of our mission is a deep respect for history and a bold vision for the future—bringing our downtown into tomorrow without losing her yesterday.
Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)3 Nonprofit Organization

Discover the Heart of Historic Downtown
Plant City in 2025
Unforgettable experiences await in historic downtown Plant City! Historic Plant City Main Street is thrilled to host over 20 days of exciting events in 2025, all designed to create vibrant moments that connect locals and visitors to the heart of our cherished community. Picture yourself enjoying the charm of Last Friday, savoring the seasonal delights at the Jingle Jangle Market, getting inspired by the creativity at the Arts Festival, raising a glass at Oktoberfest, and counting down to midnight at the dazzling Strawberry Drop. We invite you to join us in shaping the magic—become a partner and help keep our downtown thriving. Your support makes it possible to craft meaningful events that celebrate our rich history, culture, and community spirit.
Ready to plan your next adventure? In addition to Henry’s Hidden Train Hunt and the search for the Golden Train, you can explore the full event calendar and discover how you can become a partner by visiting
www.plantcitymainstreet.org/partnership
. Let’s work together to make downtown Plant City the ultimate destination for community, creativity, and connection in 2025!
DOWNLOAD A PRINTABLE EVENT CALENDAR HERE!
Discover more ways to engage with Plant City by viewing
The City of Plant City and
The Greater Plant City Chamber of Commerce event calendars.
Graduating high school is one of the biggest events of our lives. The Plant City High alumni site is made so that students and teachers from the Plant City high school can reconnect with those that they met while attending high school.  View their website here and begin reconnecting today!
http://plantcityhighschool.com/

Plant City Main Street's Last Friday in Downtown is a themed monthly, outdoor, evening market and food truck rally taking place at McCall Park in downtown Plant City the last Friday of the month from 5pm to 9pm, January through November.
Last Friday in Downtown will feature a rotating cast of artists and makers selling handmade goods, jewelry, art, wood-work, and more! Space is limited, and vendors will be selected based on their contribution to the diversity of the event as a whole. Register as a vendor here:
https://www.plantcitymainstreet.org/2023lf

9
Plant City Main Street Open House
Friday, December 9, 2022
5:00 PM
9:00 PM
Historic Plant City Main Street
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
A HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS
We are over the moon excited to formally announce that in the coming weeks we will be moving to our new home located at 110 South Collins! This space will allow us a larger place to meet, give visitors the opportunity to learn about our partners, upcoming events, and all of the incredible things we have planned for our downtown. You'll even soon get to check out our Plant City Main Street Shop full ways to show your love for local!
Whether you have lived here your entire life or are visiting our historic downtown for the first time, we hope our new home is a planned stop on your travels.
All are invited to our Plant City Main Street Open House on Friday, December 9th, 2022 between 5:00pm - 9:00pm. We will have festive goodies, great giveaways, and more throughout the evening!
Follow our Plant City Main Street Facebook and visit
www.plantcitymainstreet.org
to keep up with the latest.
We look forward to welcoming the community to our new home!

Oktoberfest: Downtown Plant City, Florida
Saturday, September 24, 2022
6:00 PM
11:00 PM
Historic Downtown Plant City, Florida
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
View fullsize
OKTOBERFEST COMING TO HISTORIC DOWNTOWN PLANT CITY, FLORIDA
Planning is underway for Plant City's very first Oktoberfest!
Save the date for Saturday, September 24th, 2022 when all the fun will take place. We'll keep some traditional aspects, and add a few signature touches to make it our very own. There are many ways you can be part of the festivities. Volunteers are needed in many areas, and as a sponsor, this is a huge opportunity to showcase your business in front of thousands. If you are interested in volunteering or being a sponsor for our inaugural Oktoberfest, reach out to our Executive Director, Dawn Hyatt, at director@plantcitymainstreet.com
Be sure to follow our
Plant City Main Street
Facebook page, and visit
www.plantcitymainstreet.org
for the very latest!

(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
Last Friday in Downtown: Harry Potter Birthday Celebration
July 29th, 2022 5pm - 9pm
McCall Park 100 North Collins Street
Historic Downtown Plant City, Florida
FREE ADMISSION
You are invited to a magical evening as our downtown transforms into a Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Make your way to Platform 9 3/4 at the The Robert W. Willaford Railroad Museum, take on the wizarding scavenger hunt, check out the Main Street Kids: zone with hands-on art, dare to ride the extreme gyrosphere, take on the giant waterslide, browse the exhibitor market, and enjoy delicious food and butterbeer all through the night. There will even be a Harry Potter-themed costume contest! Many of our downtown businesses will be open late for you to shop and embrace your love for all things local. So make plans to head into downtown for Last Friday to experience a magical summer night for the entire family!
BECOME AN EXHIBITOR: This is one of our most highly attended events and thousands will fill the streets of downtown Plant City as it transforms into a magical Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Plant City Main Street is seeking all types of vendors, small businesses, and organizations to engage with our crowds to showcase their creativity and services. We are launching a brand new vendor registration process and even if you have been a vendor in the past you will need to visit our website each month to join.
Vendors $60
Non-Profit Organizations $30
Informational Only $40
Food trucks are booked through Tampa Bay Food Trucks, but we are accepting snack and beverage vendors.
The deadline to register is July 24th, 2022 For full details and to register, visit:
https://www.plantcitymainstreet.org/last-friday-vendor-registration2022
VOLUNTEER: Be part of creating this incredible event!
https://bit.ly/3akUIxp
Keep up to date with the very latest by following our Plant City Main Street Facebook page, and visiting us at plantcitymainstreet.org

Make plans to join us in historic downtown Plant City this Friday night, July 8th beginning at 5pm as we celebrate in a BIG way!
All this month participating businesses throughout downtown will be collecting unwrapped toys for Jensen's Heart of Gold Florida. Learn more about this organization by visiting:
https://www.jensensheartofgold.com/florida-chapter
This Friday when you bring an unwrapped toy to the Jensen's tent in downtown you will be entered to win a gift card tree to local Plant City businesses!
Many small businesses will be open late with featured specials and fun including The Mercantile, Brick City Bricks, The Crafted Butterfly, Roots Tap Room & Wine Bar, Yerb Labs, Krazy Kup, Snellgroves, Three Hands Mead Company, The Tipsy Bookworm, Big Dog's Patio, TubTreats Bath & Body, Downtown Smoothie Shack, Silver Dollar Saloon, and more.

Discover the Heart of Historic Downtown
Plant City in 2025
Unforgettable experiences await in historic downtown Plant City! Historic Plant City Main Street is thrilled to host over 20 days of exciting events in 2025, all designed to create vibrant moments that connect locals and visitors to the heart of our cherished community. Picture yourself enjoying the charm of Last Friday, savoring the seasonal delights at the Jingle Jangle Market, getting inspired by the creativity at the Arts Festival, raising a glass at Oktoberfest, and counting down to midnight at the dazzling Strawberry Drop. We invite you to join us in shaping the magic—become a partner and help keep our downtown thriving. Your support makes it possible to craft meaningful events that celebrate our rich history, culture, and community spirit.
Ready to plan your next adventure? In addition to Henry’s Hidden Train Hunt and the search for the Golden Train, you can explore the full event calendar and discover how you can become a partner by visiting
www.plantcitymainstreet.org/partnership
. Let’s work together to make downtown Plant City the ultimate destination for community, creativity, and connection in 2025!

A HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS
We are over the moon excited to formally announce that in the coming weeks we will be moving to our new home located at 110 South Collins! This space will allow us a larger place to meet, give visitors the opportunity to learn about our partners, upcoming events, and all of the incredible things we have planned for our downtown. You'll even soon get to check out our Plant City Main Street Shop full ways to show your love for local!
Whether you have lived here your entire life or are visiting our historic downtown for the first time, we hope our new home is a planned stop on your travels.
All are invited to our Plant City Main Street Open House on Friday, December 9th, 2022 between 5:00pm - 9:00pm. We will have festive goodies, great giveaways, and more throughout the evening!
Follow our Plant City Main Street Facebook and visit
www.plantcitymainstreet.org
to keep up with the latest.
We look forward to welcoming the community to our new home!

Last Friday in Downtown: Harry Potter Birthday Celebration
July 29th, 2022 5pm - 9pm
McCall Park 100 North Collins Street
Historic Downtown Plant City, Florida
FREE ADMISSION
You are invited to a magical evening as our downtown transforms into a Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Make your way to Platform 9 3/4 at the The Robert W. Willaford Railroad Museum, take on the wizarding scavenger hunt, check out the Main Street Kids: zone with hands-on art, dare to ride the extreme gyrosphere, take on the giant waterslide, browse the exhibitor market, and enjoy delicious food and butterbeer all through the night. There will even be a Harry Potter-themed costume contest! Many of our downtown businesses will be open late for you to shop and embrace your love for all things local. So make plans to head into downtown for Last Friday to experience a magical summer night for the entire family!
BECOME AN EXHIBITOR: This is one of our most highly attended events and thousands will fill the streets of downtown Plant City as it transforms into a magical Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Plant City Main Street is seeking all types of vendors, small businesses, and organizations to engage with our crowds to showcase their creativity and services. We are launching a brand new vendor registration process and even if you have been a vendor in the past you will need to visit our website each month to join.
Vendors $60
Non-Profit Organizations $30
Informational Only $40
Food trucks are booked through Tampa Bay Food Trucks, but we are accepting snack and beverage vendors.
The deadline to register is July 24th, 2022 For full details and to register, visit:
https://www.plantcitymainstreet.org/last-friday-vendor-registration2022
VOLUNTEER: Be part of creating this incredible event!

Unforgettable experiences await in historic downtown Plant City! Historic Plant City Main Street is thrilled to host over 20 days of exciting events in 2025, all designed to create vibrant moments that connect locals and visitors to the heart of our cherished community. Picture yourself enjoying the charm of Last Friday, savoring the seasonal delights at the Jingle Jangle Market, getting inspired by the creativity at the Arts Festival, raising a glass at Oktoberfest, and counting down to midnight at the dazzling Strawberry Drop. We invite you to join us in shaping the magic—become a partner and help keep our downtown thriving. Your support makes it possible to craft meaningful events that celebrate our rich history, culture, and community spirit.
Ready to plan your next adventure? In addition to Henry’s Hidden Train Hunt and the search for the Golden Train, you can explore the full event calendar and discover how you can become a partner by visiting
www.plantcitymainstreet.org/partnership
. Let’s work together to make downtown Plant City the ultimate destination for community, creativity, and connection in 2025!

Plant City Main Street Open House
Friday, December 9, 2022
5:00 PM
9:00 PM
Historic Plant City Main Street
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
A HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS
We are over the moon excited to formally announce that in the coming weeks we will be moving to our new home located at 110 South Collins! This space will allow us a larger place to meet, give visitors the opportunity to learn about our partners, upcoming events, and all of the incredible things we have planned for our downtown. You'll even soon get to check out our Plant City Main Street Shop full ways to show your love for local!
Whether you have lived here your entire life or are visiting our historic downtown for the first time, we hope our new home is a planned stop on your travels.
All are invited to our Plant City Main Street Open House on Friday, December 9th, 2022 between 5:00pm - 9:00pm. We will have festive goodies, great giveaways, and more throughout the evening!
Follow our Plant City Main Street Facebook and visit
www.plantcitymainstreet.org
to keep up with the latest.
We look forward to welcoming the community to our new home!

OKTOBERFEST COMING TO HISTORIC DOWNTOWN PLANT CITY, FLORIDA
Planning is underway for Plant City's very first Oktoberfest!
Save the date for Saturday, September 24th, 2022 when all the fun will take place. We'll keep some traditional aspects, and add a few signature touches to make it our very own. There are many ways you can be part of the festivities. Volunteers are needed in many areas, and as a sponsor, this is a huge opportunity to showcase your business in front of thousands. ICS
Last Friday in Downtown: Harry Potter Birthday Celebration
July 29th, 2022 5pm - 9pm
McCall Park 100 North Collins Street
Historic Downtown Plant City, Florida
FREE ADMISSION
You are invited to a magical evening as our downtown transforms into a Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Make your way to Platform 9 3/4 at the The Robert W. Willaford Railroad Museum, take on the wizarding scavenger hunt, check out the Main Street Kids: zone with hands-on art, dare to ride the extreme gyrosphere, take on the giant waterslide, browse the exhibitor market, and enjoy delicious food and butterbeer all through the night. There will even be a Harry Potter-themed costume contest! Many of our downtown businesses will be open late for you to shop and embrace your love for all things local. So make plans to head into downtown for Last Friday to experience a magical summer night for the entire family!
BECOME AN EXHIBITOR: This is one of our most highly attended events and thousands will fill the streets of downtown Plant City as it transforms into a magical Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Plant City Main Street is seeking all types of vendors, small businesses, and organizations to engage with our crowds to showcase their creativity and services. We are launching a brand new vendor registration process and even if you have been a vendor in the past you will need to visit our website each month to join.
Vendors $60
Non-Profit Organizations $30
Informational Only $40
Food trucks are booked through Tampa Bay Food Trucks, but we are accepting snack and beverage vendors.
The deadline to register is July 24th, 2022 For full details and to register, visit:
https://www.plantcitymainstreet.org/last-friday-vendor-registration2022
VOLUNTEER: Be part of creating this incredible event!
https://bit.ly/3akUIxp
Keep up to date with the very latest by following our Plant City Main Street Facebook page, and visiting us at plantcitymainstreet.org

9:00 PM
Historic Plant City Main Street

Google Calendar
ICS
A HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS
We are over the moon excited to formally announce that in the coming weeks we will be moving to our new home located at 110 South Collins! This space will allow us a larger place to meet, give visitors the opportunity to learn about our partners, upcoming events, and all of the incredible things we have planned for our downtown. You'll even soon get to check out our Plant City Main Street Shop full ways to show your love for local!
Whether you have lived here your entire life or are visiting our historic downtown for the first time, we hope our new home is a planned stop on your travels.
All are invited to our Plant City Main Street Open House on Friday, December 9th, 2022 between 5:00pm - 9:00pm. We will have festive goodies, great giveaways, and more throughout the evening!
Follow our Plant City Main Street Facebook and visit
www.plantcitymainstreet.org
to keep up with the latest.
We look forward to welcoming the community to our new home!

July 29th, 2022 5pm - 9pm
McCall Park 100 North Collins Street
Historic Downtown Plant City, Florida
FREE ADMISSION
You are invited to a magical evening as our downtown transforms into a Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Make your way to Platform 9 3/4 at the The Robert W. Willaford Railroad Museum, take on the wizarding scavenger hunt, check out the Main Street Kids: zone with hands-on art, dare to ride the extreme gyrosphere, take on the giant waterslide, browse the exhibitor market, and enjoy delicious food and butterbeer all through the night. There will even be a Harry Potter-themed costume contest! Many of our downtown businesses will be open late for you to shop and embrace your love for all things local. So make plans to head into downtown for Last Friday to experience a magical summer night for the entire family!
BECOME AN EXHIBITOR: This is one of our most highly attended events and thousands will fill the streets of downtown Plant City as it transforms into a magical Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to the revitalization and preservation of our charming downtown through community-driven economic development, cultural enrichment, and historic preservation. As an accredited Main Street America™ program, we are committed to fostering a vibrant, welcoming destination where residents and visitors alike can experience the heart and soul of Plant City. Through signature events like Oktoberfest, Last Friday, and the inaugural Strawberry Drop, we celebrate our heritage while creating fresh opportunities for local businesses, artists, and families to thrive. At the core of our mission is a deep respect for history and a bold vision for the future—bringing our downtown into tomorrow without losing her yesterday.
Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)3 Nonprofit Organization

Plant City Main Street's Last Friday in Downtown is a themed monthly, outdoor, evening market and food truck rally taking place at McCall Park in downtown Plant City the last Friday of the month from 5pm to 9pm, January through October.
Last Friday in Downtown will feature a rotating cast of artists and makers selling handmade goods, jewelry, art, wood-work, and more! Space is limited, and vendors will be selected based on their contribution to the diversity of the event as a whole.

Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to the revitalization and preservation of our charming downtown through community-driven economic development, cultural enrichment, and historic preservation. As an accredited Main Street America™ program, we are committed to fostering a vibrant, welcoming destination where residents and visitors alike can experience the heart and soul of Plant City. Through signature events like Oktoberfest, Last Friday, and the inaugural Strawberry Drop, we celebrate our heritage while creating fresh opportunities for local businesses, artists, and families to thrive. At the core of our mission is a deep respect for history and a bold vision for the future—bringing our downtown into tomorrow without losing her yesterday.
Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)3 Nonprofit Organization

Make plans to join us in historic downtown Plant City this Friday night, July 8th beginning at 5pm as we celebrate in a BIG way!
All this month participating businesses throughout downtown will be collecting unwrapped toys for Jensen's Heart of Gold Florida. Learn more about this organization by visiting:

Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to the revitalization and preservation of our charming downtown through community-driven economic development, cultural enrichment, and historic preservation. As an accredited Main Street America™ program, we are committed to fostering a vibrant, welcoming destination where residents and visitors alike can experience the heart and soul of Plant City. Through signature events like Oktoberfest, Last Friday, and the inaugural Strawberry Drop, we celebrate our heritage while creating fresh opportunities for local businesses, artists, and families to thrive. At the core of our mission is a deep respect for history and a bold vision for the future—bringing our downtown into tomorrow without losing her yesterday.

Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to the revitalization and preservation of our charming downtown through community-driven economic development, cultural enrichment, and historic preservation. As an accredited Main Street America™ program, we are committed to fostering a vibrant, welcoming destination where residents and visitors alike can experience the heart and soul of Plant City. Through signature events like Oktoberfest, Last Friday, and the inaugural Strawberry Drop, we celebrate our heritage while creating fresh opportunities for local businesses, artists, and families to thrive. At the core of our mission is a deep respect for history and a bold vision for the future—bringing our downtown into tomorrow without losing her yesterday.
Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)3 Nonprofit Organization

Discover the Heart of Historic Downtown
Plant City in 2025
Unforgettable experiences await in historic downtown Plant City! Historic Plant City Main Street is thrilled to host over 20 days of exciting events in 2025, all designed to create vibrant moments that connect locals and visitors to the heart of our cherished community. Picture yourself enjoying the charm of Last Friday, savoring the seasonal delights at the Jingle Jangle Market, getting inspired by the creativity at the Arts Festival, raising a glass at Oktoberfest, and counting down to midnight at the dazzling Strawberry Drop. We invite you to join us in shaping the magic—become a partner and help keep our downtown thriving. Your support makes it possible to craft meaningful events that celebrate our rich history, culture, and community spirit.
Ready to plan your next adventure? In addition to Henry’s Hidden Train Hunt and the search for the Golden Train, you can explore the full event calendar and discover how you can become a partner by visiting
www.plantcitymainstreet.org/partnership
. Let’s work together to make downtown Plant City the ultimate destination for community, creativity, and connection in 2025!
DOWNLOAD A PRINTABLE EVENT CALENDAR HERE!
Discover more ways to engage with Plant City by viewing
The City of Plant City and
The Greater Plant City Chamber of Commerce event calendars.
Graduating high school is one of the biggest events of our lives. The Plant City High alumni site is made so that students and teachers from the Plant City high school can reconnect with those that they met while attending high school.  View their website here and begin reconnecting today!
http://plantcityhighschool.com/

A HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS
We are over the moon excited to formally announce that in the coming weeks we will be moving to our new home located at 110 South Collins! This space will allow us a larger place to meet, give visitors the opportunity to learn about our partners, upcoming events, and all of the incredible things we have planned for our downtown. You'll even soon get to check out our Plant City Main Street Shop full ways to show your love for local!
Whether you have lived here your entire life or are visiting our historic downtown for the first time, we hope our new home is a planned stop on your travels.
All are invited to our Plant City Main Street Open House on Friday, December 9th, 2022 between 5:00pm - 9:00pm. We will have festive goodies, great giveaways, and more throughout the evening!
Follow our Plant City Main Street Facebook and visit
www.plantcitymainstreet.org
to keep up with the latest.
We look forward to welcoming the community to our new home!

Last Friday in Downtown: Harry Potter Birthday Celebration
July 29th, 2022 5pm - 9pm
McCall Park 100 North Collins Street
Historic Downtown Plant City, Florida
FREE ADMISSION
You are invited to a magical evening as our downtown transforms into a Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Make your way to Platform 9 3/4 at the The Robert W. Willaford Railroad Museum, take on the wizarding scavenger hunt, check out the Main Street Kids: zone with hands-on art, dare to ride the extreme gyrosphere, take on the giant waterslide, browse the exhibitor market, and enjoy delicious food and butterbeer all through the night. There will even be a Harry Potter-themed costume contest! Many of our downtown businesses will be open late for you to shop and embrace your love for all things local. So make plans to head into downtown for Last Friday to experience a magical summer night for the entire family!
BECOME AN EXHIBITOR: This is one of our most highly attended events and thousands will fill the streets of downtown Plant City as it transforms into a magical Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Plant City Main Street is seeking all types of vendors, small businesses, and organizations to engage with our crowds to showcase their creativity and services. Discover the Heart of Historic Downtown
Plant City in 2025
Unforgettable experiences await in historic downtown Plant City! Historic Plant City Main Street is thrilled to host over 20 days of exciting events in 2025, all designed to create vibrant moments that connect locals and visitors to the heart of our cherished community. Picture yourself enjoying the charm of Last Friday, savoring the seasonal delights at the Jingle Jangle Market, getting inspired by the creativity at the Arts Festival, raising a glass at Oktoberfest, and counting down to midnight at the dazzling Strawberry Drop. We invite you to join us in shaping the magic—become a partner and help keep our downtown thriving. Your support makes it possible to craft meaningful events that celebrate our rich history, culture, and community spirit.
Ready to plan your next adventure? In addition to Henry’s Hidden Train Hunt and the search for the Golden Train, you can explore the full event calendar and discover how you can become a partner by visiting
www.plantcitymainstreet.org/partnership
. Let’s work together to make downtown Plant City the ultimate destination for community, creativity, and connection in 2025!
DOWNLOAD A PRINTABLE EVENT CALENDAR HERE!
Discover more ways to engage with Plant City by viewing
The City of Plant City and
The Greater Plant City Chamber of Commerce event calendars.
Graduating high school is one of the biggest events of our lives. The Plant City High alumni site is made so that students and teachers from the Plant City high school can reconnect with those that they met while attending high school.  View their website here and begin reconnecting today!
http://plantcityhighschool.com/

9:00 PM
Historic Plant City Main Street
(map)

ICS
A HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS
We are over the moon excited to formally announce that in the coming weeks we will be moving to our new home located at 110 South Collins! This space will allow us a larger place to meet, give visitors the opportunity to learn about our partners, upcoming events, and all of the incredible things we have planned for our downtown. You'll even soon get to check out our Plant City Main Street Shop full ways to show your love for local!
Whether you have lived here your entire life or are visiting our historic downtown for the first time, we hope our new home is a planned stop on your travels.
All are invited to our Plant City Main Street Open House on Friday, December 9th, 2022 between 5:00pm - 9:00pm. We will have festive goodies, great giveaways, and more throughout the evening!
Follow our Plant City Main Street Facebook and visit
www.plantcitymainstreet.org
to keep up with the latest.
We look forward to welcoming the community to our new home!

OKTOBERFEST COMING TO HISTORIC DOWNTOWN PLANT CITY, FLORIDA
Planning is underway for Plant City's very first Oktoberfest!
Save the date for Saturday, September 24th, 2022 when all the fun will take place. We'll keep some traditional aspects, and add a few signature touches to make it our very own. There are many ways you can be part of the festivities. Volunteers are needed in many areas, and as a sponsor, this is a huge opportunity to showcase your business in front of thousands. Last Friday in Downtown: Harry Potter Birthday Celebration
July 29th, 2022 5pm - 9pm
McCall Park 100 North Collins Street
Historic Downtown Plant City, Florida
FREE ADMISSION
You are invited to a magical evening as our downtown transforms into a Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Make your way to Platform 9 3/4 at the The Robert W. Willaford Railroad Museum, take on the wizarding scavenger hunt, check out the Main Street Kids: zone with hands-on art, dare to ride the extreme gyrosphere, take on the giant waterslide, browse the exhibitor market, and enjoy delicious food and butterbeer all through the night. There will even be a Harry Potter-themed costume contest! Many of our downtown businesses will be open late for you to shop and embrace your love for all things local. So make plans to head into downtown for Last Friday to experience a magical summer night for the entire family!
BECOME AN EXHIBITOR: This is one of our most highly attended events and thousands will fill the streets of downtown Plant City as it transforms into a magical Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Plant City Main Street is seeking all types of vendors, small businesses, and organizations to engage with our crowds to showcase their creativity and services. We are launching a brand new vendor registration process and even if you have been a vendor in the past you will need to visit our website each month to join.
Vendors $60
Non-Profit Organizations $30
Informational Only $40
Food trucks are booked through Tampa Bay Food Trucks, but we are accepting snack and beverage vendors.
The deadline to register is July 24th, 2022 For full details and to register, visit:
https://www.plantcitymainstreet.org/last-friday-vendor-registration2022
VOLUNTEER: Be part of creating this incredible event!
https://bit.ly/3akUIxp

Discover the Heart of Historic Downtown
Plant City in 2025
Unforgettable experiences await in historic downtown Plant City! Historic Plant City Main Street is thrilled to host over 20 days of exciting events in 2025, all designed to create vibrant moments that connect locals and visitors to the heart of our cherished community. Picture yourself enjoying the charm of Last Friday, savoring the seasonal delights at the Jingle Jangle Market, getting inspired by the creativity at the Arts Festival, raising a glass at Oktoberfest, and counting down to midnight at the dazzling Strawberry Drop. We invite you to join us in shaping the magic—become a partner and help keep our downtown thriving. Your support makes it possible to craft meaningful events that celebrate our rich history, culture, and community spirit.
Ready to plan your next adventure? In addition to Henry’s Hidden Train Hunt and the search for the Golden Train, you can explore the full event calendar and discover how you can become a partner by visiting
www.plantcitymainstreet.org/partnership
. Let’s work together to make downtown Plant City the ultimate destination for community, creativity, and connection in 2025!
DOWNLOAD A PRINTABLE EVENT CALENDAR HERE!
Discover more ways to engage with Plant City by viewing
The City of Plant City and
The Greater Plant City Chamber of Commerce event calendars.
Graduating high school is one of the biggest events of our lives. The Plant City High alumni site is made so that students and teachers from the Plant City high school can reconnect with those that they met while attending high school.  View their website here and begin reconnecting today!
http://plantcityhighschool.com/

9:00 PM
Historic Plant City Main Street
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
A HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS
We are over the moon excited to formally announce that in the coming weeks we will be moving to our new home located at 110 South Collins! This space will allow us a larger place to meet, give visitors the opportunity to learn about our partners, upcoming events, and all of the incredible things we have planned for our downtown. You'll even soon get to check out our Plant City Main Street Shop full ways to show your love for local!
Whether you have lived here your entire life or are visiting our historic downtown for the first time, we hope our new home is a planned stop on your travels.
All are invited to our Plant City Main Street Open House on Friday, December 9th, 2022 between 5:00pm - 9:00pm. We will have festive goodies, great giveaways, and more throughout the evening!
Follow our Plant City Main Street Facebook and visit
www.plantcitymainstreet.org
to keep up with the latest.
We look forward to welcoming the community to our new home!

Last Friday in Downtown: Harry Potter Birthday Celebration
July 29th, 2022 5pm - 9pm
McCall Park 100 North Collins Street
Historic Downtown Plant City, Florida
FREE ADMISSION
You are invited to a magical evening as our downtown transforms into a Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Make your way to Platform 9 3/4 at the The Robert W. Willaford Railroad Museum, take on the wizarding scavenger hunt, check out the Main Street Kids: zone with hands-on art, dare to ride the extreme gyrosphere, take on the giant waterslide, browse the exhibitor market, and enjoy delicious food and butterbeer all through the night. There will even be a Harry Potter-themed costume contest! Many of our downtown businesses will be open late for you to shop and embrace your love for all things local. So make plans to head into downtown for Last Friday to experience a magical summer night for the entire family!
BECOME AN EXHIBITOR: This is one of our most highly attended events and thousands will fill the streets of downtown Plant City as it transforms into a magical Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Plant City Main Street is seeking all types of vendors, small businesses, and organizations to engage with our crowds to showcase their creativity and services. We are launching a brand new vendor registration process and even if you have been a vendor in the past you will need to visit our website each month to join.
Vendors $60
Non-Profit Organizations $30
Informational Only $40
Food trucks are booked through Tampa Bay Food Trucks, but we are accepting snack and beverage vendors.
The deadline to register is July 24th, 2022 For full details and to register, visit:
https://www.plantcitymainstreet.org/last-friday-vendor-registration2022
VOLUNTEER: Be part of creating this incredible event!
https://bit.ly/3akUIxp

5:00 PM
9:00 PM
Historic Plant City Main Street
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
A HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS
We are over the moon excited to formally announce that in the coming weeks we will be moving to our new home located at 110 South Collins! This space will allow us a larger place to meet, give visitors the opportunity to learn about our partners, upcoming events, and all of the incredible things we have planned for our downtown. You'll even soon get to check out our Plant City Main Street Shop full ways to show your love for local!
Whether you have lived here your entire life or are visiting our historic downtown for the first time, we hope our new home is a planned stop on your travels.
All are invited to our Plant City Main Street Open House on Friday, December 9th, 2022 between 5:00pm - 9:00pm. We will have festive goodies, great giveaways, and more throughout the evening!
Follow our Plant City Main Street Facebook and visit
www.plantcitymainstreet.org
to keep up with the latest.
We look forward to welcoming the community to our new home!

ICS
Last Friday in Downtown: Harry Potter Birthday Celebration
July 29th, 2022 5pm - 9pm
McCall Park 100 North Collins Street
Historic Downtown Plant City, Florida
FREE ADMISSION
You are invited to a magical evening as our downtown transforms into a Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Make your way to Platform 9 3/4 at the The Robert W. Willaford Railroad Museum, take on the wizarding scavenger hunt, check out the Main Street Kids: zone with hands-on art, dare to ride the extreme gyrosphere, take on the giant waterslide, browse the exhibitor market, and enjoy delicious food and butterbeer all through the night. There will even be a Harry Potter-themed costume contest! Many of our downtown businesses will be open late for you to shop and embrace your love for all things local. So make plans to head into downtown for Last Friday to experience a magical summer night for the entire family!
BECOME AN EXHIBITOR: This is one of our most highly attended events and thousands will fill the streets of downtown Plant City as it transforms into a magical Harry Potter Birthday Celebration! Plant City Main Street is seeking all types of vendors, small businesses, and organizations to engage with our crowds to showcase their creativity and services. We are launching a brand new vendor registration process and even if you have been a vendor in the past you will need to visit our website each month to join.
Vendors $60
Non-Profit Organizations $30
Informational Only $40
Food trucks are booked through Tampa Bay Food Trucks, but we are accepting snack and beverage vendors.
The deadline to register is July 24th, 2022 For full details and to register, visit:
https://www.plantcitymainstreet.org/last-friday-vendor-registration2022
VOLUNTEER: Be part of creating this incredible event!
https://bit.ly/3akUIxp

Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to the revitalization and preservation of our charming downtown through community-driven economic development, cultural enrichment, and historic preservation. As an accredited Main Street America™ program, we are committed to fostering a vibrant, welcoming destination where residents and visitors alike can experience the heart and soul of Plant City. Through signature events like Oktoberfest, Last Friday, and the inaugural Strawberry Drop, we celebrate our heritage while creating fresh opportunities for local businesses, artists, and families to thrive. At the core of our mission is a deep respect for history and a bold vision for the future—bringing our downtown into tomorrow without losing her yesterday.

Plant City Main Street's Last Friday in Downtown is a themed monthly, outdoor, evening market and food truck rally taking place at McCall Park in downtown Plant City the last Friday of the month from 5pm to 9pm, January through October.
Last Friday in Downtown will feature a rotating cast of artists and makers selling handmade goods, jewelry, art, wood-work, and more! Space is limited, and vendors will be selected based on their contribution to the diversity of the event as a whole.

Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to the revitalization and preservation of our charming downtown through community-driven economic development, cultural enrichment, and historic preservation. As an accredited Main Street America™ program, we are committed to fostering a vibrant, welcoming destination where residents and visitors alike can experience the heart and soul of Plant City. Through signature events like Oktoberfest, Last Friday, and the Strawberry Drop, we celebrate our heritage while creating fresh opportunities for local businesses, artists, and families to thrive. At the core of our mission is a deep respect for history and a bold vision for the future — “Bringing Our Downtown Into Tomorrow Without Losing Her Yesterday”. - DMH
Meet the Team
Karen Knox
A hometown is more than a place, it’s a feeling of belonging.
Born and raised in Plant City, Karen cherishes the community and the events that bring people together. She’s seen the city grow over the years while still holding onto its small-town charm.
Karen spent many years at the ballfield cheering on her son and daughter, and now enjoys watching her grandkids do the same. She also shares a love for livestock and looks forward to seeing her grandkids follow in her daughter’s footsteps showing animals. A proud Plant City Toastmaster, Karen once won the District 84 Humorous Speech Contest with a story about her daughter and her pig, Bacon Bits.
Karen currently works at Primo Brands as an Enterprise Leader and spent 28 years prior with Progressive. With over 39 years in customer service, she values helping others and believes consistency builds trust.
She is honored to serve on Historic Plant City Main Street and give back to the community that’s given her so much.
Jenny Rothman
Immediate Past Board President
A Plant City resident since childhood, Jenny Rothman is a Realtor with LPT Realty and owner of Grits & Berries. She has served in leadership roles for local organizations, including the Junior Women’s Club and the Sirens of Golden Sabre. Passionate about her community, Jenny focuses on her career and fitness journey while continuing to volunteer and support Plant City’s growth. She is proud to serve on the Historic Plant City Main Street Board.
Lizzette Sarria
Board Vice President
As a seasoned accountant and Certified Fraud Examiner, Lizzette Sarria has been helping businesses grow and succeed since founding her company in 2001. A strong advocate for economic growth and historic preservation, she envisions downtown Plant City as a thriving hub for residents and visitors alike. Lizzette brings her financial expertise and love for the community to her role on the Historic Plant City Main Street Board.
Kim Taylor
Board Treasurer
Kim Taylor is a long-time Plant City resident and successful business owner, running her forklift company for over 21 years. A proud mother of four and grandmother of six, Kim is deeply dedicated to her family and her community. She has a passion for helping others, especially the elderly and those in need, and enjoys participating in recreational activities like four-wheeling and fishing. Kim is honored to serve on the Historic Plant City Main Street Board, where she works to support local growth and connection.
Alex Rae Rhoades
Board Secretary
Born and raised in Plant City, Alex Rae Rhoades is passionate about preserving the city’s charm and culture. A graduate of the University of Florida and the University of South Florida, she has dedicated her career to education, communication, and marketing. Alex Rae actively supports local nonprofits, including the Tampa Gator Club and the Florida Strawberry Festival. She is excited to contribute to the vibrant downtown culture through her role on the Historic Plant City Main Street Board.
Jake Buckner
Board Member
A Tampa Bay native, Jake Buckner is the Nationwide Product Manager for GT Grandstands and a proud graduate of Leadership Plant City. He has a background in entrepreneurship, having successfully built and sold his own marine detailing business. Jake is passionate about volunteering, fishing, and the outdoors. He is excited to contribute to the growth and vitality of Plant City through his role on the Historic Plant City Main Street Board.
Tammy Chancey
Board Member
With more than 20 years of real estate experience, Tammy brings both expertise and a true heart for community to her new role. As team leader of Team Chancey, she is recognized for her energy, professionalism, and passion for helping others.
Her background in corporate training and event planning fuels her enthusiasm for creating meaningful experiences that bring people together. Actively involved in local service organizations and charitable initiatives, Tammy is dedicated to strengthening small businesses and celebrating the spirit of Plant City.
Kathleen Kilton
Board Member
Kathleen Kilton is a dedicated Plant City community member with extensive volunteer experience across organizations like the YMCA, the United Food Bank, and Friends at the Park. She is passionate about supporting Plant City’s growth while preserving its small-town charm. Kathleen’s commitment to creating meaningful events and fostering community connection makes her a valued member of the Historic Plant City Main Street Board.
Kaleb McDonald
Board Member
Kaleb McDonald is a Plant City native and proud business owner of Mac’s Excavating Inc. He cherishes his hometown, where he lives with his wife, Jordan, and their growing family. Kaleb enjoys boating and spending time with his loved ones. Committed to his community, he is excited to give back through his role on the Historic Plant City Main Street Board.
Robert Tuppeny
Board Member
Originally from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, Robert Tuppeny has called Plant City home for over 21 years. He co-owns The Crafted Butterfly in downtown Plant City with his wife, Diane, and manages visual merchandising for MacDill Air Force Base and other military locations in Florida. With 30 years of experience in visual merchandising, Robert is passionate about community, family, and creativity. He is proud to serve on the Historic Plant City Main Street Board.
Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to the revitalization and preservation of our charming downtown through community-driven economic development, cultural enrichment, and historic preservation. As an accredited Main Street America™ program, we are committed to fostering a vibrant, welcoming destination where residents and visitors alike can experience the heart and soul of Plant City. Through signature events like Oktoberfest, Last Friday, and the Strawberry Drop, we celebrate our heritage while creating fresh opportunities for local businesses, artists, and families to thrive. At the core of our mission is a deep respect for history and a bold vision for the future — “Bringing Our Downtown Into Tomorrow Without Losing Her Yesterday”. - DMH
Meet the Team
Karen Knox
A hometown is more than a place, it’s a feeling of belonging.
Born and raised in Plant City, Karen cherishes the community and the events that bring people together. She’s seen the city grow over the years while still holding onto its small-town charm.
Karen spent many years at the ballfield cheering on her son and daughter, and now enjoys watching her grandkids do the same. She also shares a love for livestock and looks forward to seeing her grandkids follow in her daughter’s footsteps showing animals. A proud Plant City Toastmaster, Karen once won the District 84 Humorous Speech Contest with a story about her daughter and her pig, Bacon Bits.
Karen currently works at Primo Brands as an Enterprise Leader and spent 28 years prior with Progressive. With over 39 years in customer service, she values helping others and believes consistency builds trust.
She is honored to serve on Historic Plant City Main Street and give back to the community that’s given her so much.

Plant City Main Street's Last Friday in Downtown is a themed monthly, outdoor, evening market and food truck rally taking place at McCall Park in downtown Plant City the last Friday of the month from 5pm to 9pm, January through October.
Last Friday in Downtown will feature a rotating cast of artists and makers selling handmade goods, jewelry, art, wood-work, and more! Space is limited, and vendors will be selected based on their contribution to the diversity of the event as a whole.

Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to the revitalization and preservation of our charming downtown through community-driven economic development, cultural enrichment, and historic preservation. As an accredited Main Street America™ program, we are committed to fostering a vibrant, welcoming destination where residents and visitors alike can experience the heart and soul of Plant City. Through signature events like Oktoberfest, Last Friday, and the inaugural Strawberry Drop, we celebrate our heritage while creating fresh opportunities for local businesses, artists, and families to thrive. At the core of our mission is a deep respect for history and a bold vision for the future—bringing our downtown into tomorrow without losing her yesterday.
Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)3 Nonprofit Organization

Plant City Main Street's Last Friday in Downtown is a themed monthly, outdoor, evening market and food truck rally taking place at McCall Park in downtown Plant City the last Friday of the month from 5pm to 9pm, January through October.
Last Friday in Downtown will feature a rotating cast of artists and makers selling handmade goods, jewelry, art, wood-work, and more! Space is limited, and vendors will be selected based on their contribution to the diversity of the event as a whole.

OKTOBERFEST COMING TO HISTORIC DOWNTOWN PLANT CITY, FLORIDA
Planning is underway for Plant City's very first Oktoberfest!
Save the date for Saturday, September 24th, 2022 when all the fun will take place. We'll keep some traditional aspects, and add a few signature touches to make it our very own. There are many ways you can be part of the festivities. Volunteers are needed in many areas, and as a sponsor, this is a huge opportunity to showcase your business in front of thousands. If you are interested in volunteering or being a sponsor for our inaugural Oktoberfest, reach out to our Executive Director, Dawn Hyatt, at director@plantcitymainstreet.com
Be sure to follow our
Plant City Main Street
Facebook page, and visit
www.plantcitymainstreet.org
for the very latest!

A HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS
We are over the moon excited to formally announce that in the coming weeks we will be moving to our new home located at 110 South Collins! This space will allow us a larger place to meet, give visitors the opportunity to learn about our partners, upcoming events, and all of the incredible things we have planned for our downtown. You'll even soon get to check out our Plant City Main Street Shop full ways to show your love for local!
Whether you have lived here your entire life or are visiting our historic downtown for the first time, we hope our new home is a planned stop on your travels.
All are invited to our Plant City Main Street Open House on Friday, December 9th, 2022 between 5:00pm - 9:00pm. We will have festive goodies, great giveaways, and more throughout the evening!
Follow our Plant City Main Street Facebook and visit
www.plantcitymainstreet.org
to keep up with the latest.
We look forward to welcoming the community to our new home!
.

A HOME FOR THE HOLIDAYS
We are over the moon excited to formally announce that in the coming weeks we will be moving to our new home located at 110 South Collins! This space will allow us a larger place to meet, give visitors the opportunity to learn about our partners, upcoming events, and all of the incredible things we have planned for our downtown. You'll even soon get to check out our Plant City Main Street Shop full ways to show your love for local!
Whether you have lived here your entire life or are visiting our historic downtown for the first time, we hope our new home is a planned stop on your travels.
All are invited to our Plant City Main Street Open House on Friday, December 9th, 2022 between 5:00pm - 9:00pm. We will have festive goodies, great giveaways, and more throughout the evening!
Follow our Plant City Main Street Facebook and visit
www.plantcitymainstreet.org
to keep up with the latest.
We look forward to welcoming the community to our new home!

Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to the revitalization and preservation of our charming downtown through community-driven economic development, cultural enrichment, and historic preservation. As an accredited Main Street America™ program, we are committed to fostering a vibrant, welcoming destination where residents and visitors alike can experience the heart and soul of Plant City. Through signature events like Oktoberfest, Last Friday, and the inaugural Strawberry Drop, we celebrate our heritage while creating fresh opportunities for local businesses, artists, and families to thrive. At the core of our mission is a deep respect for history and a bold vision for the future—bringing our downtown into tomorrow without losing her yesterday.
